subsc: Roads and highways,General education sector,Central government administration

abstracts.cdata!:
The Public Expenditure Management
            Adjustment Credit Project will support measures to:  i)
            reorient public expenditures toward education, health, road
            maintenance, and rural development, which will benefit the
            country's poor in the context of a medium-term
            expenditure framework (MTEF);  ii) ensure the quality and
            volume of basic social services while maintaining conditions
            amenable to a stable macroeconomic situation; and iii)
            strengthen budget implementation, monitoring, and control.
            The project has two components.  The first will restructure
            public expenditures by giving more emphasis to the four
            sectors identified by the Government as priority areas
            (education, health, rural development, and road
            maintenance).  The second will strengthen budgetary
            implementation and control through the adoption of a
            computer-based public sector financial system, more rigorous
            implementation of the regulatory framework, especially those
            related to financial control and procurement, and the
            simplification of budgetary processes.
